But the version we are using is spring cloud gateway 2.2.2.RELEASE. When skywalking 8.1.0 / 8.2.0 is used, the tracking information cannot be obtained normally, and the span cannot be connected in series according to traceId.

I just gave you the fact of testing. Our test codes are verifying the plugin, and also for you to compare what is the difference. Because, in the reality, we can't test every version and every usage you could do.

In the plugin case, we always prefer you could find the issue first, even send a pull request to fix. The libraries with versions are countless. This is not a job for one man or a limited group of people. We are looking forward to the whole community including the end-users to maintain the plugin system.

Referring to the test example given above, I also tested it with the following version:
1) spring boot 2.2.10.RELEASE
2) spring cloud Hoxton.SR5
3) spring cloud gateway 2.2.3.RELEASE

The results as follows:
The traceId obtained by spring cloud gateway, sc-consumer and sc-provider is still independent.
The traceId obtained by spring cloud gateway is "A", and traceId obtained by sc-consumer and sc-provider is "B". 
So the whole request trace cannot be connected in series by traceId .
